info.description: The Network Cloud APIs provide management of the on-premises clusters and their resources, such as, racks, bare-metal hosts, virtual machines, workload networks and more.
info.title: NetworkCloud

get.description: Get a list of all available resource provider operations. It contains a URL link to get the next set of results.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description:
Apply rack manifests to a cluster. This would update the existing cluster by applying rack manifests that have no rack associated yet.
The API returns 202 Accepted as the operation is performed asynchronously.

parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the managed resource.
parameters.name: resourceName

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

AggregatorRackSkuSpported.description:
Note that this will only contain references to the aggregator rack.
A secondary lookup of that aggregator rack SKU will provide the references to the Compute rack SKU information.
AggregatorRackSkuSpported.title: Aaggregator rack SKU details supported by the cluster manager.

id.description: Resource ID of the Rack SKU

name.description: A descriptive name of the rack sku

AzureCommonProperties.description:
AzureCommonProperties are parameters that can be included on requests but are processed by RPaaS and not by this
resource provider. They are listed as optional resources because RPaaS will enforce which parameters are required.

id.description: Id is the ID of an existing Azure resource that this resource provider will manage.

location.description: Location is the Azure location where this resource will exist or already exists.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource that this resource provider will create.

type.description: Type is the type of resource that this resource provider will create.

BareMetalMachineProperties.title: BareMetalMachineProperties represents the properties of a baremetal machine.

adminStatus.description: Admin status of the bare-metal machine.

bmcConnectionString.description: The connection string for the bare-metal controller on this bare-metal machine.

bootMacAddress.description: MAC address of a NIC connected to the PXE network.

clusterId.description: A fully-qualified identifier of the undercloud cluster this bare-metal machine is associated with.

cordonStatus.description: Cordon status of the bare-metal machine.

machineDetails.description:
Details provided by the customer during the creation of rack manifests
that allows for custom data to be associated with this machine

machineLocation.description:
A user-friendly description of the bare-metal machine's location.
+kubebuilder:validation:Optional

machineSkuId.description: A unique internal identifier of the bare-metal machine SKU.

powerState.description: Power state of the bare-metal machine.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the bare-metal machine.

rackId.description: Resource identifier of the rack where this bare-metal machine resides.

rackSlot.description: Rack slot in which this bare-metal machine is located, ordered from the bottom up i.e. the lowest slot is 1.

readyState.description: Indicator of whether the bare-metal machine is ready to receive workloads.

tpmEndorsementKey.description: A thumbprint or SHA of the TPM endorsement key that ensures authenticity of the bare-metal machine.

BareMetalMachineStatus.description: BareMetalMachineStatus denotes the status of the bare-metal machine

detailedStatus.description: A more detailed status of the bare-metal machine.

detailedStatusMessage.description: A descriptive message about the current detailed status.

bmcConnectionString.description: The connection string for the bare-metal controller on this bare-metal machine.

bmcMacAddress.description: MAC address of the bare-metal controller on this machine.

bootMacAddress.description: The MAC address of a NIC connected to the PXE network.

machineDetails.description: Additional optional details such as SerialNumber, AssetTag, etc.

machineName.description:
A user provided name for the bare-metal machine created from this user data.
If not provided, a name will be generated programmatically.

rackSlot.description:
The slot in which this physical machine is located, ordered from the bottom up i.e. the lowest slot is 1.
It is positional, so the first machine at the bottom is rackSlot: 1, the second machine up is rackSlot: 2.

tpmEndorsementKey.description:
The thumbprint or SHA of the TPM Endorsement Key that allows the resource provider to ensure
authenticity of the machine.

BmcCredentials.title: Credentials for the baseboard management controller device on this baremetal machine.

password.description: The baseboard management controller device server password.

username.description: The baseboard management controller device user name

Cluster.description: A cluster is the top level object for the on-premise environment.
Cluster.title: Cluster represents an on-Premise Network Cloud cluster

id.description: Id is the ID of an existing Azure resource that this resource provider will manage.

location.description: Location is the Azure location where this resource will exist or already exists.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource that this resource provider will create.

type.description: Type is the type of resource that this resource provider will create.

ClusterAvailableUpgradeVersion.description: ClusterAvailableUpgradeVersion represents the various cluster upgrade parameters

controlImpact.description: The indicator of whether the control plane will be impacted during the upgrade.

expectedDuration.description: The expected duration needed for this upgrade.

impactDescription.description: The impact description including the speficil details and release notes.

targetClusterVersion.description: The target version this cluster will be upgraded to.

workloadImpact.description: The indicator of whether the workload will be impacted during the upgrade.

ClusterList.title: ClusterList represents a list of Clusters.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

ClusterManager.description: A ClusterManager creates and  manages customer manager instances on demand.
ClusterManager.title: ClusterManager represents a control-plane to manage one or more on-premises clusters.

id.description: Id is the ID of an existing Azure resource that this resource provider will manage.

location.description: Location is the Azure location where this resource will exist or already exists.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource that this resource provider will create.

type.description: Type is the type of resource that this resource provider will create.

ClusterManagerList.description: ClusterManagerList represents a list of cluster manager objects.
ClusterManagerList.title: List of cluster manager objects.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

ClusterManagerProperties.description: ClusterManagerProperties represents the properties of a cluster manager

aggregatorRackSkusSpported.description: A list of the aggregrator rack SKUs supported by the cluster manager.

analyticsWorkspaceId.description: AnalyticsWorkspace is where any logs relevant to customer will be relayed for example "/microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces/{logAnalyticsWorkspaceName}"

clusterVersions.description: ClusterVersions represents all the cluster versions the manager supports which would be used as input in the cluster clusterVersion property.

fabricControllerId.description: URI reference to the fabric controller that is 1:1 with the cluster manager

ClusterPatchProperties.title: ClusterPatchProperties represents the properties of a cluster during Patch.

clusterLocation.description: The customer-provided location information to identify where the cluster resides.

ClusterProperties.description:
https://armwiki.azurewebsites.net/rpaas/arc-rp/conversion/SchemaTranslation.html#default-kubernetes-bridge-mapping

for now, we'll align on the same concept for our RPaaS
objects as well

ClusterProperties represents the properties of a cluster.
ClusterProperties.title:
Note, k8s bridge resource types will default to
a singular status field under properties

analyticsWorkspaceId.description: The customer must specify a Log Analytics Workspace upon creation. This workspace will be where any logs that are relevant to

availableUpgradeVersions.description: The list of cluster runtime version upgrades available for this cluster.

clusterExtendedLocation.description:
The extended location (custom location) represents the cluster's control plane location.
This extended location is used to route the requests of child objects of the cluster that are handled by the platform operator.

clusterLocation.description: The customer-provided location information to identify where the cluster resides.

clusterManagerId.description:
The resource ID of the cluster manager that manages this cluster.
This is set by the Cluster Manager when the cluster is created.

clusterType.description:
The type of rack configuration for this cluster.
single-rack SingleRack
multi-rack MultiRack

clusterVersion.description: The current version of the cluster runtime.

networkFabricId.description: The resource ID of the network fabric associated with the cluster.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the cluster.

ClusterStatus.description: ClusterStatus denotes the status of a cluster

clusterTrusted.description: The indicator of whether or not to trust that the cluster is uncompromised.

deploymentState.description: The state of the cluster's deployment.

ClustersPatchPayload.description: ClustersPatchPayload represents the body of the request

ClustersUpdateVersionPayload.title: ClustersUpdateVersionPayload represents the body of the request.

targetClusterVersion.description: Version to be applied to the cluster during update.

CreatedByType.description: CreatedByType defines user type, which executed the request

ExtendedLocation.description:
ExtendedLocation is the Azure custom location where this resource will be created
required: true

name.description: ResourceId of the custom location on which resource will be created

HardwareInventory.description: including information acquired from the model/sku information and from the ironic inspector.
HardwareInventory.title: HardwareInventory is the hardware configuration of this machine as exposed to the customer,

nics.description: A list of network interface cards and associated details for the bare-metal machine.

Nic.title: Nic is the network interface card details.

macAddress.description: The MAC address associated with this NIC.

RackManifest.title: RackManifest is the unprocessed, user-submitted intention for a rack located in an on-premises cluster.

extendedLocation.description: the extended location of the cluster controller that manages this rack manifest

id.description: Id is the ID of an existing Azure resource that this resource provider will manage.

location.description: Location is the Azure location where this resource will exist or already exists.

RackManifestList.title: RackManifestList represents a list of RackManifests.

RackManifestProperties.title: RackManifestProperties represesnts the properties of a rack manifest.

baremetalMachineUserData.description: A list of bare-metal machine objects in this rack (not ordered).

clusterId.description: The resource ID of the cluster to which this rack is associated.

clusterManagerId.description:
The resource ID of the cluster manager that manages this rack manifest.
This is set by the Cluster Manager when the rack manifest is created.

networkRackId.description: The resource ID to the associated network rack resource

rackId.description:
The resource ID of the rack that was realized by the deployment of this rack manifest.
Once assigned, this rack manifest can no longer be used in a future deployment or update operations.
It is effectively used up.

rackLocation.description: A free-form customer description of this rack location. FOr example, "DTN Datacenter, Floor 3, Aisle 9, Rack 2".

rackSerialNumber.description: A globally unique identifier for the rack.

rackSkuId.description: The resource ID of the SKU for the rack being added.

SystemData.title: SystemData metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

createdAt.description: The timestamp of the resource creation.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of the last resource update.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that modified the resource last.

VirtualMachineNetworkAttachment.description: VirtualMachineNetworkAttachement represents a single network attachment

ipAllocationMethod.description: IPAllocationMethod defines mechanism for IP allocation.

ipv4Address.description:
IPv4Address represents IPv4 address of a VM.
This field is only used if the associated WorkloadNetwork has a IPAllocationType of IPv4 or Dual-Stack.
If IPAllocationMethod is:
Static - this field must contain a user specified IPv4 address from within the subnet specified in the WorkloadNetwork.
Dynamic - this field is read-only, but will be populated with an address from within the subnet specified in the WorkloadNetwork.
Disabled - this field will be empty.

ipv6Address.description:
IPv6Address represents IPv6 address of a VM.
This field is only used if the associated WorkloadNetwork has a IPAllocationType of IPv6 or Dual-Stack.
If IPAllocationMethod is:
Static - this field must contain a user specified IPv6 address from within the subnet specified in the WorkloadNetwork.
Dynamic - this field is read-only, but will be populated with an address from within the subnet specified in the WorkloadNetwork.
Disabled - this field will be empty.

workloadNetwork.description: Workload network attached to the VM.

VirtualMachinePlacementHint.description: VirtualMachinePlacementHint represents a single scheduling hint of virtual machine

VirtualMachineProperties.title: VirtualMachineProperties represents the properties of a virtual machine.

bareMetalMachineURI.description: URI of the bare metal machine VM has landed to.

cluster.description: Name of undercloud cluster VM is created with.

cpuCores.description: Number of CPU cores in the virtual machine.

diskSizeGB.description: Virtual machine root disk size in GiB.

imageReference.description: URL to virtual machine OCI image.

memorySizeGB.description: Virtual machine memory size in GiB.

networkConfigurationVersion.description: Version of virtual machine network configuration.

powerState.description: PowerState reflects the state that of the Virtual Machine.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the Virtual Machine. This field should not be visible to the customer.

WorkloadNetwork.description: WorkloadNetwork represents an on-premises workload network

id.description: Id is the ID of an existing Azure resource that this resource provider will manage.

location.description: Location is the Azure location where this resource will exist or already exists.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource that this resource provider will create.

type.description: Type is the type of resource that this resource provider will create.

WorkloadNetworkList.title: WorkloadNetworkList represents a list of WorkloadNetworks.

nextLink.description: The link used to get the next page of operations.

WorkloadNetworkProperties.title: WorkloadNetworkProperties represents the properties of a workload network.

allowMulticast.description: The parameter enables the required features of the NIC/Driver to support multicast.

clusterId.description: The resourceId of the Network Cloud cluster this workload network is associated with.

hostPluginType.description: The network plugin type of the workload network, defaults to "SRIOV".

hybridAksClustersAssociatedIds.description: The list of Hybrid AKS cluster ID(s) that are associated with this workload network.

hybridAksIpamEnabled.description: The HybridAksIpam Enabled parameter denotes whether or not to disable IP Address Management(IPAM) allocation on this network attachment definition.

hybridAksPluginType.description: The network plugin type for HybridAKS, defaults to "HOST-DEVICE".

interfaceName.description: The interface related to the workload network.

ipAllocationType.description: The type of the IP address allocation, defaulted to "Dual-Stack".

ipv4AddressPrefixIndex.description: The index of IPv4AddressPrefix list to be used for this workload network. Given a routing domain can have multiple IPv4 prefixes assigned to it, this parameter defines the prefix this workload network is associated with. The index value is zero-based, with the first entry being an index value of 0.

ipv6AddressRangeIndex.description: The index of the IPv6RangePrefix list to be used for this Workload Network. Given a routing domain can have multiple IPv6 ranges assigned to it, this parameter defines the range this workload network is associated with.The index value is zero-based, with the first entry being an index value of 0.

maxTxRate.description: The maximum transmission rate, in Mbps, for the virtual function (VF).

minTxRate.description: The minimum transmission rate, in Mbps, for the virtual function (VF).

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the workload network.

routingDomainIds.description: The list of routing domain ID(s) associated with this workload network.

spoofCheckEnabled.description: This denotes whether or not to enable spoof checking on the VF allocated for this network. Note: you may not configure this when we are leveraging a VirtualPluginType of MACVLAN. This leverages multiple mac addresses and thus spoofchecking must be disabled on the VF.

trunkRoutingDomains.description: The parameter indicates if the routing domains should be trunked. If more than one routing domain is supplied, and this value is set to "False", only the first Routing Domain will be utilized.

virtualMachinesAssociatedIds.description: The list of virtual machine ID(s), excluding any Hybrid AKS virtual machines, that are currently using this workload network.
